pageContext.claim: “Women’s unemployment rate is down to 3.6% - was 7.9% in January, 2011. Things are looking good!”
pageContext.analysis: This is one way to spin an underwhelming jobs report in February. It's also quite wrong. The women's unemployment rate for February 2019 was initially reported as 3.4 percent by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, then revised to 3.8 percent. (It was never pegged at 3.6 percent.) The jobless rate for women was 8.5 percent in January 2011, not 7.9 percent, as Trump tweeted. He also seems to have picked an arbitrary baseline in January 2011, while this indicator was at a peak. It has been declining since.
